alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Campbell; Franklin (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 7:48PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Campbell, southwestern Bedford and northeastern Franklin Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 748 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Huddleston. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bedford... Altavista... Hurt... Huddleston... Moneta... Penhook... and Leesville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. If on or near Smith Mountain Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
